image.altText: Artist stands over table of his artwork, motioning at them with his hands

props.synopsis: Cole White lives with Down syndrome and is often non-verbal — but through art, he has found a new way to express himself.

title.children: Cole started creating art to decorate his mum's house. Now he's had his first solo exhibition

image.altText: GettyImages-2223761764

props.synopsis: Adelaide leap into the top four with a hard fought win over Melbourne, while Sydney keep a faint heartbeat in their season after defeating Fremantle.

title.children: 'Hopefully not an ACL': Concern for star Crow in victory

image.altText: A Port Adelaide player grimaces as he is helped from the ground by medical staff during an AFL game.

props.synopsis: The defending premiers Brisbane get the job done against Port Adelaide at the Gabba, with a potentially serious injury to Sam Powell-Pepper, while Hawthorn beat the Saints at Docklands.

title.children: Power coach gets emotional after Powell-Pepper injury in Lions loss

image.altText: A fish with a flat head, long tail, brown stripes across its back and red rash, on the beach

props.synopsis: An algal bloom killing marine life in South Australia is persisting despite winter conditions. So what do we know about the bloom, and — perhaps more importantly — what don't we know?

title.children: What we know about the ecological disaster washing up on SA's coast

image.altText: The headquarters of oil and gas company Santos.

props.synopsis: There are fears for around 50 jobs at the regional SA site as the company looks to "simplify" operations.

title.children: Regional SA jobs at risk as Santos reviews Port Bonython site

image.altText: French bulldog in a blue sweater held by a woman, standing near steps and open outdoor spaces under clear skies

props.synopsis: A cold start to winter encourages people to put clothes on their dogs, but a vet has noticed a spate of wounds related to ill-fitting straps, prompting a warning to be careful what you buy.

title.children: Warning as dogs suffer 'horrific' injuries from jackets and jumpers

image.altText: A hand holds a remote pointed towards a large TV.

props.synopsis: Earlier this week its free-to-air channels were replaced with red screens when Seven West Media and WIN TV failed to agree on how much Seven would pay WIN to broadcast its programming.

title.children: Channel 7 back on air in regional SA, NSW after securing new WIN deal

image.altText: Woman with respiratory illness, blowing her nose into handkerchief.

props.synopsis: Reported flu cases across South Australia have spiked 70 per cent this year, with more than 1,000 cases in the last week alone. It has coincided with another rise in ambulance ramping, which soared in June to its second-highest level on record.

title.children: 'Alarming' spike in SA flu cases as ambulance ramping soars again

image.altText: A design proposal for the former Glenside hospital site.

props.synopsis: The South Australian government has approved a developer's controversial bid to build apartments of up to 20 storeys in Adelaide's inner-eastern suburbs.

title.children: Rezoning approved for 20-storey apartments outside Adelaide CBD

image.altText: A court sketch of Keith Russell Yandle.

props.synopsis: Convicted killer Keith Russell Yandle, whose victim was found buried at a property north of Adelaide in 2023, has been jailed for 32 years over the "calculated, ruthless" shooting murder.

title.children: Killer jailed for 32 years over 'calculated, ruthless' murder

image.altText: A white sign with green and black text and a basic map of Orana's properties. A plant is blurred in the foreground.

props.synopsis: A magistrate is scathing of the 38-year-old woman's use of clients' bank cards at a residential care facility, disputing claims that she was in a "complete drug psychosis" at the time of offending.

title.children: Disability worker's theft from clients 'a betrayal without decency'

image.altText: A man with short brown hair wearing a black tshirt is kneeling down and patting a dog.

props.synopsis: Port Lincoln's mayor says the grisly nature of the alleged murder of one of the town's long-time residents has been acutely felt in the community.

title.children: Coastal town reels after man allegedly killed by reality TV contestant

image.altText: A CCTV still shows perpetrator walking and holding what police allege is a knife.

props.synopsis: The father, mother and brother of a woman who was the victim of an "honour" stabbing in Adelaide's north have had their sentences reduced.

title.children: Sentences reduced for family members convicted over 'honour' stabbing

image.altText: A man with a beard wearing a check shirt, standing in front of a sign that says Golden North Ice Cream

props.synopsis: Locals say Golden North and the SA town of Laura are synonymous with each other, but the ice cream manufacturer is set to close its local factory.

title.children: SA town shocked at Golden North ice cream's exit

image.altText: A man wearing a police uniform.

props.synopsis: A newspaper article published this week reported a "high-ranking" SA police officer had accidentally fired their gun while attending a house in suburban Adelaide during the 1990s. Here's how the commissioner responded.

title.children: SA's police chief has opened up about a 1991 firearm incident — here's what was said

image.altText: Robert Bogucki, a young bearded man wearing dirty jumper and backpack, scratches his head next to water hole

props.synopsis: In 1999 a young American dumped his bicycle and walked out into the Great Sandy Desert. Why was he willing to risk his life, and why do some people need to get lost in in order to feel found?

title.children: Decades after he disappeared into the desert, Robert Bogucki returns

image.altText: Flood striken bunk beds inside a cabin

props.synopsis: Two nine-year-old campers are among dozens of people dead after river waters rose eight metres in just 45 minutes near their camp north of San Antonio.

title.children: Nine-year-old campers among dozens killed in Texas floods

image.altText: Two messages on a phone both say "hey".

props.synopsis: Users of popular same-sex hook-up and dating apps are being targeted by violent offenders, but many victims fear reporting out of fears of exposure.

title.children: Catfishing teens behind rise in homophobic attacks

image.altText: Horse in bridle and headpiece, silhouette against rising sun.

props.synopsis: Horse owners are encouraged to vaccinate their animals against the disease which can be fatal to both horses and, in rare cases, humans.

title.children: Queensland records first case of fatal disease in three years

image.altText: Silhouette of a woman's head coloured purple with small puzzle pieces falling out of the back

props.synopsis: After witnessing my mum's cognitive decline and with dementia now the leading cause of death for Australian women, I can't help but wonder: Will I be among them?

title.children: My mother was diagnosed with dementia. I'm doing everything to minimise my risk

image.altText: lions lying down

props.synopsis: It's understood the woman lost an arm after the incident at the Darling Downs Zoo near Toowoomba.

title.children: Woman was watching keepers at work when she was bitten by lion

image.altText: empty block between concrete buildings where a building used to be with yellow earth moving equipment and trucks around rubble

props.synopsis: The death toll from the collapse of a residential building in the Pakistani megacity of Karachi grows as rescue teams work for a second day in search of survivors.

title.children: Residents heard cracking before deadly apartment collapse in Pakistan

image.altText: Lions at Sneddon grave

props.synopsis: The tragic story of the British and Irish Lions' first captain has a surprising link to the Maitland Rugby Club, which has preserved his legacy for 137 years, attracting the touring 2025 squad.

title.children: Inaugural rugby captain who drowned mid-tour remembered by Lions in Hunter Valley

image.altText: Tam Goddard

props.synopsis: Pet owners would be legally required to spend a minimum of three hours with their dog every day under the proposed laws, but questions remain about how such laws would be enforced.

title.children: New rules proposed around how long you must spend with your dog

image.altText: An aerial image of a housing development with a green arrow pointing downwards next to a percentage sign

props.synopsis: The decisions of the Reserve Bank's board impact the budgets of many Australians — either directly or indirectly — so it's a pretty big deal. Here's what to expect from this week's meeting.

title.children: We're expecting another rate cut this week. Will more cuts follow?

image.altText: Ben O'Connor crashes with his buike in the air and the rider on the ground

props.synopsis: Ben O'Connor is a late faller on a chaotic first day of the Tour de France as two key contenders lose time after a split and two riders abandon the race after crashes.

title.children: 'Banged-up' Ben O'Connor crashes on 'crazy' first day of Tour

image.altText: A tennis player stretches out to hit a ball back over the net.

props.synopsis: Alex de Minaur sets up a showdown with Novak Djokovic at Wimbledon, as Daria Kasatkina goes out in straight sets.

title.children: De Minaur faces mammoth Wimbledon test after victory

image.altText: A Palestinian looks on at the site of Israeli strike at refugee camp in Gaza

props.synopsis: Israel will send a team to Qatar after Hamas said it was ready to start talks "immediately" on a US-backed ceasefire proposal.

title.children: Netanyahu to meet Trump following 'unacceptable' ceasefire negotiations

image.altText: Daniel is wearing a black suit with a white button up shirt

props.synopsis: The National NAIDOC Awards have wrapped up for another year. Here's your guide to the winners list.

title.children: Daniel Hunt wins coveted NAIDOC Person of the Year

image.altText: An old Tibetan man in red robes leans over to pat a koala, held by a young girl. A blond4e woman and a small boy sit beside them

props.synopsis: To Tibetans all over the world, His Holiness is a hugely important spiritual and political leader.

title.children: The Dalai Lama turns 90 and delivers Tibetan Buddhists an answer

image.altText: Melissa McIntosh the Royal Easter Show.

props.synopsis: Senior Liberal Melissa McIntosh says parents are right to be angry at politicians, including herself, for failing to do enough to keep children in care safe from abuse.

title.children: Senior Liberal says parents right to be furious at politicians for failing children

image.altText: Thailand's Prime Minister Paetongtarn Shinawatra smiles and waves through a rolled-down car window.

props.synopsis: Paetongtarn Shinawatra is a photogenic, wealthy daughter of a powerful political family that has been at the top of Thai politics. But now she has fallen from grace.

title.children: The dynasty that has dominated Thailand may have run out of power

image.altText: A room full of people performing tactile Auslan and smiling

props.synopsis: Very little progress has been made on "once-in-a-generation" disability reforms since they were first announced in 2023, leaving many in the sector concerned some people could be left behind.

title.children: As the government clamps the NDIS, is this the future of disability support?

image.altText: A nighttime photograph of the eco-hut and the galaxy above.

props.synopsis: A lodging in New South Wales has become the first to be internationally recognised as "dark-sky" accommodation, where visitors can take in the wonders of a clear night sky with little light pollution.

title.children: Australia's first 'dark-sky' accommodation sparks hopes of tourism boom
